蟃字的基本解释

蟃
wàn
〔蟃蜒（
螟蛉。y刵 ）〕古书上说的一种兽。

蟃字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wàn］
［《廣韻》無販切，去願，微。］
(1)见“蟃蜒”。
(2)桑虫。即螟蛉。
(3)通“曼”。长。

蟃字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　蟃； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1096第01
【唐韻】【集韻】?無販切，音萬。【玉篇】螟蛉，蟲也。【詩·小雅】螟蛉有子。【疏】俗謂之桑蟃。【爾雅·釋蟲】螟蛉，桑蟲。【註】桑蟃，亦曰戎女。　又蟃蜒。【司馬相如·子虛賦註】蟃蜒，大獸，似貍，長百尋。

蟃字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
蟃字的起名意思

暂无。

蟃
Basic explanation of words
蟃
wàn
〔蟃蟃（
bollworm. y 刵)] a kind of beast said in ancient books.
蟃
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wàn］
["Guangyun" no sales cut, go to wish, micro. ]
(1) See "蟃韃".
(2) Mulberry. That is, the moth.
(3) Through "Man". long.
蟃
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shenzhen Collection] [Insect Character Department] 　蟃; Kangxi Strokes: 17; Page Number: Page 1096 No. 01
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun]? No sales cut, thousands of sounds. 【Jade articles】The worms are also insects. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】The moth has children. 【Sparse】The mulberry is commonly known as mulberry. 【Erya·Release Insects】Morphs, mulberry insects. [Note] Sang Pan, also called Rong girl.　Yuan again. 【Notes on Sima Xiangru·Zixu Fu】Punju, a big beast, like a raccoon dog, long Baixun.
